verses.verse: At this<WH2063> also<WH637> my heart<WH3820> trembleth,<WH2729> and is moved<WH5425> out of his place.<WH4480> <WH4725>
Hear attentively<WH8085> <WH8085> the noise<WH7267> of his voice,<WH6963> and the sound<WH1899> that goeth out<WH3318> of his mouth.<WH4480> <WH6310>
He directeth<WH3474> it under<WH8478> the whole<WH3605> heaven,<WH8064> and his lightning<WH216> unto<WH5921> the ends<WH3671> of the earth.<WH776>

After <WH310> it a voice<WH6963> roareth:<WH7580> he thundereth<WH7481> with the voice<WH6963> of his excellency;<WH1347> and he will not<WH3808> stay<WH6117> them when<WH3588> his voice<WH6963> is heard.<WH8085>
God <WH410> thundereth<WH7481> marvelously<WH6381> with his voice;<WH6963> great things<WH1419> doeth<WH6213> he, which we cannot<WH3808> comprehend.<WH3045>
For <WH3588> he saith<WH559> to the snow,<WH7950> Be<WH1933> thou on the earth;<WH776> likewise to the small<WH4306> rain,<WH1653> and to the great<WH4306> rain<WH1653> of his strength.<WH5797>
He sealeth up<WH2856> the hand<WH3027> of every<WH3605> man;<WH120> that all<WH3605> men<WH376> may know<WH3045> his work.<WH4639>
Then the beasts<WH2416> go<WH935> into<WH1119> dens,<WH695> and remain<WH7931> in their places.<WH4585>
Out of<WH4480> the south<WH2315> cometh<WH935> the whirlwind:<WH5492> and cold<WH7135> out of the north.<WH4480> <WH4215>
By the breath<WH4480> <WH5397> of God<WH410> frost<WH7140> is given:<WH5414> and the breadth<WH7341> of the waters<WH4325> is straitened.<WH4164>
Also <WH637> by watering<WH7377> he wearieth<WH2959> the thick cloud:<WH5645> he scattereth<WH6327> his bright<WH216> cloud: <WH6051>

And it<WH1931> is turned<WH2015> round about<WH4524> by his counsels:<WH8458> that they may do<WH6466> whatsoever<WH3605> <WH834> he commandeth<WH6680> them upon<WH5921> the face<WH6440> of the world<WH8398> in the earth.<WH776>
He causeth it to come,<WH4672> whether<WH518> for correction,<WH7626> or<WH518> for his land,<WH776> or<WH518> for mercy.<WH2617>
Hearken <WH238> unto this,<WH2063> O Job:<WH347> stand still,<WH5975> and consider<WH995> the wondrous<WH6381> works of God.<WH410>
Dost thou know<WH3045> when God<WH433> disposed<WH7760> <WH5921> them, and caused the light<WH216> of his cloud<WH6051> to shine?<WH3313>
Dost thou know<WH3045> <WH5921> the balancings<WH4657> of the clouds,<WH5645> the wondrous works<WH4652> of him which is perfect<WH8549> in knowledge?<WH1843>
How <WH834> thy garments<WH899> are warm,<WH2525> when he quieteth<WH8252> the earth<WH776> by the south<WH4480> <WH1864> wind?
Hast thou with<WH5973> him spread out<WH7554> the sky,<WH7834> which is strong,<WH2389> and as a molten<WH3332> looking glass?<WH7209>
Teach <WH3045> us what<WH4100> we shall say<WH559> unto him; for we cannot<WH3808> order<WH6186> our speech by reason<WH4480> <WH6440> of darkness.<WH2822>
Shall it be told<WH5608> him that<WH3588> I speak?<WH1696> if<WH518> a man<WH376> speak,<WH559> surely<WH3588> he shall be swallowed up.<WH1104>
And now<WH6258> men see<WH7200> not<WH3808> the bright<WH925> light<WH216> which<WH1931> is in the clouds:<WH7834> but the wind<WH7307> passeth,<WH5674> and cleanseth<WH2891> them.
Fair weather<WH2091> cometh<WH857> out of the north:<WH4480> <WH6828> with<WH5921> God<WH433> is terrible<WH3372> majesty.<WH1935>

Touching the Almighty,<WH7706> we cannot<WH3808> find him out:<WH4672> he is excellent<WH7689> in power,<WH3581> and in judgment,<WH4941> and in plenty<WH7230> of justice:<WH6666> he will not<WH3808> afflict.<WH6031>
Men <WH376> do therefore<WH3651> fear<WH3372> him: he respecteth<WH7200> not<WH3808> any<WH3605> that are wise<WH2450> of heart.<WH3820>
